&destinationMetrics;
The name of the queue
comma-separated list of JNDI bindings (use ',' if u need to use commas in your jndi name)
The address to route messages to once the message has been delivered more than the configured number of times. This is specified by 'Max Delivery Attempts'. Default is no dead letter address
The Address to route messages to once they have expired. Default is no Expiry Address
The maximum size in bytes of messages that can be delivered to this queue. -1 means no limit, if limit is set then 'Address Full Message Policy' specifies what should happen
The size in bytes that an address can reach before paging starts. -1 means no limit.
The max number of pages in the soft memory cache.
The maximum time to attempt delivery of a message to a consumer, once hit the message is routed to which ever address is specified by 'Dead Letter Address'
The delay (in milli seconds) before re routing a message to this Address after an unsuccessful delivery attempt has occurred. default 0 means no delay
Is this queue a last value queue. A last value queue can only ever contain a single message for each value for the message property '_HQ_LVQ_NAME'.
How long to wait (in milli seconds) before redistributing messages to another node when clustered when a queue has no consumers. Default -1 means do not re distribute.
Whether or not messages routed to this address gets sent to dead letter address when no consumers are available
The policy to use when this Address is full. PAGE means that the message will be paged, DROP means that messages are just dropped and BLOCK means that the client will block on send until the queue clears some messages

metric.description: JNDI Bindings of this connection factory

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.c:description: Name of the connection factory to deploy

c:simple-property.name: ha
c:simple-property.c:description: whether or not this connection factory will support high availability

c:simple-property.name: useDiscovery
c:simple-property.c:description: whether or not to use connectors or discovery

c:simple-property.name: cfType
c:simple-property.c:description: the connection factory type

c:simple-property.name: connectorNames
c:simple-property.c:description: comma-separated list of either connector names or a discovery group name

c:simple-property.name: Bindings
c:simple-property.c:description: comma-separated list of JNDI bindings (use ',' if u need to use commas in your jndi name)

c:simple-property.name: ClientID
c:simple-property.c:description: Client ID for connections created by this connection factory

c:simple-property.name: DupsOKBatchSize
c:simple-property.c:description: batch size (in bytes) between acknowledgements when using DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE mode

c:simple-property.name: TransactionBatchSize
c:simple-property.c:description: batch size (in bytes) between acknowledgements when using a transacted session

c:simple-property.name: ClientFailureCheckPeriod
c:simple-property.c:description: period used, in milli seconds to check if a client has failed to receive pings from the server

c:simple-property.name: ConnectionTTL
c:simple-property.c:description: connection time-to-live (in milliseconds)

c:simple-property.name: CallTimeout
c:simple-property.c:description: blocking calls timeout (in milliseconds)

c:simple-property.name: ConsumerWindowSize
c:simple-property.c:description: window size (in bytes) used for consumer flow control

c:simple-property.name: ConsumerMaxRate
c:simple-property.c:description: maximum rate of message consumption (in messages per seconds), -1 means no rate set.

c:simple-property.name: ConfirmationWindowSize
c:simple-property.c:description: size (in bytes) for the confirmation window of clients using this connection factory, -1 means no window.

c:simple-property.name: ProducerMaxRate
c:simple-property.c:description: maximum rate of message production (in messages per seconds), -1 means no rate set.

c:simple-property.name: ProducerWindowSize
c:simple-property.c:description: window size (in bytes) used for producer flow control, -1 means no window.

c:simple-property.name: CacheLargeMessagesClient
c:simple-property.c:description: Whether consumers created through this factory will cache large messages in temporary files

c:simple-property.name: MinLargeMessageSize
c:simple-property.c:description: message size threshold (in bytes) before treating messages as large messages

c:simple-property.name: BlockOnNonDurableSend
c:simple-property.c:description: whether producers will block while sending non-durable messages or send them asynchronously

c:simple-property.name: BlockOnAcknowledge
c:simple-property.c:description: whether consumers will block while sending message acknowledgements or send them asynchronously

c:simple-property.name: BlockOnDurableSend
c:simple-property.c:description: whether producers will block while sending persistent messages or send them asynchronously

c:simple-property.name: AutoGroup
c:simple-property.c:description: whether producers will automatically assign a group ID to their messages

c:simple-property.name: PreAcknowledge
c:simple-property.c:description: whether messages will pre-acknowledged on the server before they are sent to the consumers or not

c:simple-property.name: RetryInterval
c:simple-property.c:description: interval (in milliseconds) to retry connections created by this factory after failure

c:simple-property.name: MaxRetryInterval
c:simple-property.c:description: maximum retry interval (in milliseconds)

c:simple-property.name: RetryIntervalMultiplier
c:simple-property.c:description: multiplier to apply to successive retry intervals

c:simple-property.name: ReconnectAttempts
c:simple-property.c:description: maximum number of attempts to retry connection in case of failure

c:simple-property.name: ScheduledThreadPoolMaxSize
c:simple-property.c:description: maximum size of the scheduled thread pool

c:simple-property.name: ThreadPoolMaxSize
c:simple-property.c:description: maximum size of the thread pool, -1 means unlimited

c:simple-property.name: GroupID
c:simple-property.c:description: group ID that will be eventually set on each message, default is no group id.

c:simple-property.name: InitialMessagePacketSize
c:simple-property.c:description: initial size (in bytes) of messages created through this factory

c:simple-property.name: UseGlobalPools
c:simple-property.c:description: whether this factory will use global thread pools (shared among all the factories in the same JVM) or its own pools

c:simple-property.name: ConnectionLoadBalancingPolicyClassName
c:simple-property.displayName: Connection Load Balancing Policy Class Name
c:simple-property.c:description: class name of the connection load balancing policy
